entry.title: MS-DOS / Windows CD Driver Script.

entry.content:
So, I was using MS-DOS. And I wanted to get CD Driver on it, and I had to follow a walkthrough for it, and so, I just decided to make a BATCH Script instead.

This allows you just to type two things:

A:

SETUP

That is it. Here it is in action on a VM:

So... Have fun!

entry.title: Happy New Year!
entry.summary: This is all the post was.

entry.title: Last post for 2020. (A post will be made in 2021.)
entry.summary: This year has been hard for many people. There is no denying that. Not everyone got COVID-19, but my heart goes out to those who were. And I would like to say, thank you, everyone. For everything that everyone has done to help make the…
entry.content:
This year has been hard for many people. There is no denying that. Not everyone got COVID-19, but my heart goes out to those who were. And I would like to say, thank you, everyone. For everything that everyone has done to help make the Internet a better place throughout this whole Pandemic.

The TF2 Community is still in shock over what happened to Rick May. For those who don't know, Rick May was the voice of Soldier in a game called Team Fortress 2. He passed away due to COVID-19 on April 13th, 2020.

This year has been hard. Here is to a better year next year.

entry.title: TheCrafters001 Flash Player 2 is Officially Discontenued.
entry.summary: It pains me as much as it pains everyone else... but Flash is dead, and so is Flash Player 2...
entry.content:
It pains me as much as it pains everyone else... but Flash is dead, and so is Flash Player 2...

Downloads will remain online for as long as I can tolerate it...

entry.title: New Website
entry.summary: Hi. Me again. I know that this site seems a bit... well... very different.
entry.content:
Hi. Me again. I know that this site seems a bit... well... very different.

That is because I actually swapped back to Publii (god, I need to find a solution and stick with it). Anyways... this is my new website. It looks very different. I really want to make my own theme for Publii, but I don't know how, as the code is confusing to look at. Anyways... yeah. That is about it. Right now this is the only thing on the website, aside from one other page, but I kinda need that one.

entry.title: The future of TheCrafters001 Flash Player.
entry.summary: A while ago, I made an announcement that TheCrafters001 Flash Player 3 would be coming, using the Electron Framework.
entry.content:
A while ago, I made an announcement that TheCrafters001 Flash Player 3 would be coming, using the Electron Framework.

Well, I am sad to say, that will not be happening. I will not be supporting TheCrafters001 Flash Player anymore. And with that, you can still use my tool to play flash games, but I don't think it will do any good, because at some point, Microsoft will be removing Flash compatibility from Windows. I know this sucks. But that doesn't mean you still can't play your favorite games.

I recommend that you use BlueMaxima's Flashpoint. It is an open-source, free to use, software. The goal of this project is to keep Flash alive.

I use my own tool I made to play flash games, but I guess it is time to move on with the times. As of today, December 31st, 2020, Adobe will officially kill Flash Player, and soon all major browsers will get updates that remove Flash Player from them.

This sucks, use, but we have to accept that Flash isn't supported anymore. But if you still want to play your favorite games, check out Flashpoint. As of this post, they have over 80 THOUSAND games archived.

And if you are worried about your data, don't be. All the software does is download the flash game to your computer, and runs them. And games that are site-locked, will be hosted inside your machine.

I am sorry to bring you this news on New Years Eve, but it is the truth we all have to accept now, Flash Player, is officially dead.
